QuestionJSON.Question: Surfer has an idea to create a web application that matches babysitters with families in need. The app requires babysitters to provide extensive personal information and checks this against various public and private databases to ensure babysitters' authenticity. In order to protect the babysitters' personal information, Surfer needs to implement security measures. Which of the following security measures should Surfer potentially employ?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Surfer should store all personal information in plain text and provide open access to all developers to speed up development time.
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Surfer should implement strong password protections, enable multi-factor authentication, encrypt all personal information and rigorously control developer access.
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Surfer should forgo the background checking aspect of the app to avoid storing potentially sensitive information.
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Surfer should sell the personal information to offset the costs of background checks and database authentication.
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Protecting personal data is extremely important both ethically and legally, and it should be a priority in any system that handles such data. Using strong password protections, enabling multi-factor authentication (2FA), and encrypting the data provides a layered security approach. Additionally, limiting developer access to production data can help prevent data leaks and breaches.
